TEXT: CARDINAL . ORG The first applicant , PERSON , PERSON . ( " PERSON " ) , is a private limited company entered in the ORG register at ORG ) . CARDINAL . PERSON works land in the municipality of ORG . It cultivates the land , extracts salt and breeds fish .
CARDINAL . ORG It owns part of this land , having bought the parcels in question on different occasions .

The remainder was worked under a concession granted under a royal decree of DATE to PERSON . LAW decree provided that the parcels of land over which the concession had been granted could be expropriated without any right to compensation for the grantees . In DATE PERSON assigned the concession to ORG do PERSON . When that company was wound up , some of its former shareholders purchased the concession . They formed the PERSON company whose object was in particular to purchase and work part of the salt marshes which were the subject matter of the concession . On CARDINAL DATE that company executed a sale and purchase agreement before a notary in respect of those parcels of land . The transfer of the usable area of the third glebe of the ORG parcel [ ORG ] ... together with the parcels of land known as ORG and PERSON ... is registered in favour of the PERSON company ... , which purchased them ... for a total price of MONEY [ sic ] ... CARDINAL . ORG In a decision of CARDINAL DATE ORG decided to stay the proceedings and dismissed the company ’s application . It held that Article CARDINAL para . CARDINAL of LAW was not applicable to the case before it because LAW no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL had suspended the effect of the public - interest declaration contained in LAW no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL . A measure which had no existence in the legal order could not lapse . Moreover , it was necessary to await the outcome of the application against LAW no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL . In any event , the public - interest declaration contained in LAW no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL could be revived if Legislative Decree no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL were to be quashed .

CARDINAL . ORG At the same time , the company applied to ORG of ORG for the effects ( eficacia ) of Decree no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL to be suspended . CARDINAL . ORG On DATE PERSON applied to the same court for an order quashing the decree . This application was submitted to the Prime Minister ’s office ( see paragraph DATE below ) .
The company relied on the following grounds , among others :

( b ) the reasons given by the Government on each occasion to justify the expropriations were different and inconsistent , a bird sanctuary and an aquacultural research station being incompatible with each other ; and Legislative Decree no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL purported to create a single reserve on the land ;

ORG Having seen the Prime Minister ’s letter of CARDINAL DATE ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) and forwarded a copy of its application ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) , PERSON , in accordance with Articles CARDINAL et seq . of LAW , requested reconstitution ( reforma ) of the administrative file . CARDINAL . ORG At DATE PERSON filed a memorial and an opinion . On DATE ORG made his final submissions in favour of quashing the contested measure . In an order of CARDINAL DATE the reporting judge expressed the view that all the issues raised in the appeal were essentially dependent on whether the company was the owner of the land . In these circumstances ORG should stay the proceedings until the relevant civil court had ruled on ownership in separate proceedings . Consequently , pursuant to LAW no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL governing the administrative and tax courts ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) , it was ordered that the proceedings be stayed .

On an appeal by the company , ORG quashed that order on DATE on the ground that the reporting judge did not have jurisdiction to make it . After itself considering the issue , the court stayed the proceedings to enable the company to commence proceedings in the civil courts , given that if the parties took no action for DATE , the issue would be decided on the evidence in the file ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) .
The company has appealed against that decision to a full court of ORG which has not , at the date of adoption of the present judgment , yet decided the appeal .

CARDINAL . ORG By Legislative Decree no . CARDINAL of CARDINAL DATE the ORG created ORG on the ORG and adopted rules for the protection of the area ’s ecosystem . CARDINAL . ORG Article CARDINAL of the LAW provides :
" CARDINAL . The right to private property and the right to transfer property inter vivos or by succession shall be guaranteed to everyone , in accordance with the LAW .
CARDINAL . ORG and expropriation in the public interest may be effected only in accordance with law and subject to payment of fair compensation . "
CARDINAL . ORG LAW , as it applied at the material time , contained the following provisions :

" Real property and the rights relating to it may be expropriated on public - interest grounds in so far as such grounds fall within the competence of the expropriating authority , subject to payment of fair compensation . "
" A public - interest declaration shall lapse if the property has not been acquired within DATE or if no arbitration board has been set up within DATE . "
" Expropriation of a property or right on public - interest grounds shall confer on the expropriated person the right to receive fair compensation . "
CARDINAL . ORG Articles CARDINAL and CARDINAL para . CARDINAL of the DATE LAW , which is currently applicable , provide as follows :

" Real property and the rights relating to it may be expropriated on public - interest grounds in so far as such grounds fall within the competence of the expropriating authority , subject to immediate payment of fair compensation . "
" Expropriation of any property or right on public - interest grounds shall entitle the expropriated person to immediate payment of fair compensation . "
CARDINAL . ORG LAW no . CARDINAL of DATE provided as follows :

" CARDINAL . Administrative decisions which are final and enforceable may be challenged by means of an application for judicial review , which shall be made to the competent court and lodged with the authority that took the decision in question .
CARDINAL . The administrative authority may , within DATE , revoke or confirm the impugned decision in whole or in part .
CARDINAL . In any event , the administrative authority shall , within the same period , forward the administrative file containing the relevant documents to the appropriate court or tribunal .
CARDINAL . If there is no production , the applicant may ask the court to take possession of the file and documents concerning the applicant so that the proceedings may continue .
CARDINAL . ... "
CARDINAL . ORG This provision was amended by LAW no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL of DATE , which contains the following relevant Articles :

" Where either party fails , for DATE , to make , or diligently pursue an application on a preliminary issue then the main proceedings shall continue and the preliminary issue shall be decided on the basis of such evidence as is admissible in those proceedings . The effects of such a decision shall be confined solely to the proceedings in question . "

" CARDINAL . Where , without good cause , evidence relevant to the determination of the case is not produced , the court may order any appropriate measures , including the CARDINAL provided for in LAW no . CARDINAL of DATE , and shall issue an injunction to the administrative authority in question , in accordance with LAW .
CARDINAL . Where the administrative authority again fails to comply , the court may draw such inferences from that conduct as it thinks fit . "

CARDINAL . Refusal to comply with the injunction shall give rise to civil , disciplinary and criminal liability in accordance with LAW no . CARDINAL of DATE . "
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL para . CARDINAL of Legislative Decree no . CARDINAL of DATE governing administrative and tax courts is worded as follows :

" Where a decision on the merits of the action or appeal turns on the determination of an issue within the jurisdiction of other courts , the tribunal may defer judgment until the relevant court has given its ruling ; the consequences of a failure by the interested parties to make or diligently pursue the proceedings concerning the preliminary issue shall be laid down in procedural provisions . "
CARDINAL . ORG LAW no . CARDINAL of CARDINAL DATE provides :

" CARDINAL . Where , without justification , the case file relating to an administrative application [ processo gracioso ] , or any other evidence requested by a court in order to assist its examination of an appeal , is not produced within DATE the reporting judge shall forward the appeal to ORG office , in order that the latter may make its submissions within DATE , failing which the penalties set out in the following paragraph shall apply .

CARDINAL . Where a period of DATE has elapsed following submission of the opinion of ORG office , as provided for in paragraph CARDINAL , and the documents requested have , without good cause , not been produced , the proceedings shall resume and the court may draw such inferences from the conduct of the authority in question as it sees fit . "
CARDINAL . ORG Order no . CARDINAL of CARDINAL DATE issued by ORG is worded as follows :

" CARDINAL . Taking note of Legislative Decree no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL of CARDINAL May , which concerns all the land that is the subject of a royal concession granted by Government Decree no . CARDINAL of DATE , without any restriction or discrimination in respect of such land ;

CARDINAL . Observing that much of this land , amounting to QUANTITY , is now private property which has nothing to do with the aims of protecting the environment and natural resources which it is said will be achieved by withdrawing the concession , thereby entailing a flood of potential lawsuits and payment by the ORG of huge amounts of compensation ;

CARDINAL . Observing that the statutory provision refers expressly to ORG do PERSON " or , in other words , " Herdade do Muro do PERSON " , which represents only a small part of the land covered by the royal concession of DATE ;
CARDINAL . Observing likewise that even the " Herdade do Muro do Ludo " is only partly of special interest from the point of view of protecting bird life ;
CARDINAL . Decides to set up a committee ... to make a proposal concerning :
( i ) the repeal of Legislative Decree no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL and any other legislation on this subject ;

( ii ) the tabling of a draft of a new legislative decree intended to transfer to the ORG as part of the national heritage all the land which , being part of the estate designated as " PERSON do PERSON " or outside it , is of value for the bird life which it is sought to protect by means of establishing a sanctuary ;
( iii ) compensation or a fair method for calculating such compensation based on the improvements [ benfeitorias ] made to the land to be transferred to the ORG ;
( iv ) the final regularisation of the land in private hands [ dominio particular ] which is of no value for the sanctuary and was covered by the royal concession of DATE .

CARDINAL . The committee thus appointed is to carry out its task before DATE ; however , the proposal for the repeal of Legislative Decree no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , duly reasoned , shall be submitted to ORG by DATE so as to be put on the agenda of the next meeting of the ORG and shall contain any provisions that may be necessary to make clear that the ORG remains interested in the sanctuary and is determined to transfer as part of the national heritage the land to be incorporated in it .
